title: Enel Will Return in the Final Saga
theoryText: Enel's departure to the moon on the Ark Maxim is not the end of his story. Given his connection to the ancient moon civilization, his knowledge of Fairy Vearth, and the increasing importance of moon lore in One Piece's endgame, Enel will return to play a significant role in the Final Saga. The parallels between Enel and Imu (both destroy islands from the sky, both have god complexes, both command loyal followers) suggest Enel may become relevant again.
author: Various fans across multiple platforms

sources.title: Like It or Not, One Piece Just Set Up the Return of Its Most Controversial Villain
One Piece: The Return Of Enel, Explained

title: Fairy Vearth Is Not the Moon - It's the Sunken Continent
theoryText: Some fans theorize that 'Fairy Vearth' (Endless Earth) that Enel seeks is not actually the moon, but rather the ancient landmass that existed before the world was flooded 900 years ago during the Void Century. This would mean Enel's journey to the moon was based on a misunderstanding of ancient texts. The true 'endless earth' would be the sunken continent that once existed before the 200-meter sea level rise, portions of which now form the Red Line.
author: Worstgen Forum User

sources.title: The Endless Earth Enel Searched For Wasn't The Moon; It Is The Sunken Continent

title: The Ark Maxim's Gold Came From the Ancient Kingdom
theoryText: The fact that the Ark Maxim was constructed using gold from Shandora (the City of Gold) is significant. Shandora was part of the ancient civilization that fought during the Void Century. The Poneglyph the Shandia protected contained information about Poseidon. This suggests that the gold used to build Enel's ark may have special properties or significance related to the ancient kingdom, and that Enel unknowingly used materials connected to the lost history he was trying to escape.
author: One Piece analysis community

title: Enel's Heart Restart Foreshadows Advanced Devil Fruit Applications
theoryText: Enel's ability to restart his own heart using his Devil Fruit powers demonstrates an incredibly advanced understanding of how Devil Fruits can be used beyond simple combat applications. This medical/scientific application of Devil Fruit powers foreshadows later revelations about Devil Fruit Awakening and creative power usage. It suggests that many Devil Fruit users are limiting themselves by only thinking about combat applications.
author: One Piece theorists

title: The 200 Jet Dials From Birka Hold Significance
theoryText: Enel specifically brought 200 Jet Dials from his destroyed homeland of Birka to power the Ark Maxim as a backup system. The specific number (200) and the fact that he preserved them from Birka before destroying it suggests these Dials may have historical or cultural significance. They could be connected to the moon people who originally came to Birka, or they might be the last remnants of Birkan technology that Enel wanted to preserve.
author: Skypiea lore theorists
